item.title: Ukraine Air Force commander dismissed after F-16 crash
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: Mykola Oleshchuk, the head of Ukraine’s Air Force, was replaced a day after the military said one of its Western-supplied F-16 fighter jets crashed this week.

item.title: Israeli evacuation orders force displaced Gazans into ever-smaller spaces
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Samuel Granados, Hajar Harb, Cate Brown
item.description: Israeli evacuation orders in August have shrunk Gaza’s only humanitarian zone by nearly a third and deepened the plight of displaced Palestinians.

item.title: Israel strikes aid convoy organized by U.S. humanitarian group, killing 5
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Adela Suliman, Kelsey Ables, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The Anera convoy was carrying medical supplies and fuel to a hospital in Rafah, and its route was coordinated in advance with the IDF.

item.title: As Germany’s far right reaches milestone moment, extremists grow bolder
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Kate Brady
item.description: The AfD could emerge for the first time as the strongest party in a German state parliament after Sunday elections in Saxony and Thuringia.

item.title: What Ukraine’s Kursk incursion means for the war with Russia
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Ukraine is hoping for an escape to victory.

item.title: Ukrainian F-16 crashes, killing pilot, during Russian missile attack
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The demise of one of Ukraine’s star pilots as well as one of its prized few F-16 jets is a massive blow for Kyiv as it seeks to gain momentum against Russia.

item.title: WHO says Gaza polio vaccine campaign to begin Sunday
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung
item.description: Israel, health officials said, has agreed to “humanitarian pauses” to allow more than 600,000 children to be vaccinated amid an outbreak of the disease.

item.title: Israel kills Palestinian commander, traps civilians in West Bank incursion
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Claire Parker, John Hudson, Sufian Taha , Annabelle Timsit
item.description: The ongoing Israeli military operation killed at least 16 people, according to Israeli and Palestinian authorities, including a prominent commander.

item.title: Biden administration restarts migrant program, boosting fraud checks
item.dc:creator: Nick Miroff
item.description: Illegal crossings along the southern border by migrants from Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela have declined sharply since the parole program was launched.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine energy war roars back into action after mediation fails
item.dc:creator: David Stern, Ellen Francis
item.description: Russian refineries burn as Ukraine’s cities go dark ahead of a cold winter and renewed targeting of the energy sectors.

item.title: Namibia to cull elephants, zebras for their meat during major drought
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset
item.description: The southern African country plans to distribute the meat of hundreds of animals, including hippos and antelopes, to support relief efforts.

item.title: An FBI quest to return sacred human skulls stolen from a Pacific tribe
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: The repatriation comes amid a visit by Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell, who said U.S. law enforcement assistance to the Pacific was set to grow.

item.title: Israel launches major operation in West Bank; Palestinian officials say 11 killed
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Loveday Morris, Frances Vinall, Claire Parker, Hazem Balousha, Cate Brown
item.description: Israel’s military and internal security service said the operation was aimed at infrastructure used by militants in the cities of Jenin and Tulkarm.

item.title: In a grim Russian cell, a hippie LGBTQ artist survived with her inner joy
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: Alexandra Skochilenko became known for flashing a smile and heart symbols in court even as she was sentenced to seven years in prison for a minor antiwar protest.

item.title: Israel agrees to brief pause in Gaza for polio vaccinations, U.S. official says
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Frances Vinall
item.description: Word of the planned campaign came as the World Food Program said it suspended movement of its staff in Gaza after a clearly marked WFP vehicle came under fire.

item.title: Reuters denies Russian claim its slain security adviser was British spy
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel
item.description: Russia’s Foreign Ministry spokeswoman connected the killing of security adviser Ryan Evans to foreign mercenaries aiding Ukrainian troops.

item.title: How many hostages are still in Gaza since Hamas attack on Israel? What to know.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Sammy Westfall, Helier Cheung
item.description: Israel estimates some 117 hostages held by Hamas have been released or freed; 70 are believed still to be alive in Gaza. Here’s what we know.
